Home / Documentation / Runtime Configuration

Runtime Configuration

Environment type, logging levels, output format, and interactive mode settings.

Last updated:
On this page
  • Configuration
  • Fields
  • Environment Types
  • Log Levels
  • Output Formats
  • Environment-Specific Examples
    • Development
    • Production
    • CI/CD
  • Environment Variables

Runtime settings control environment behavior, logging verbosity, output format, and interactive prompts.

Configuration

# .systemprompt/profiles/local/profile.yaml
runtime:
  environment: development
  log_level: verbose
  output_format: text
  no_color: false
  non_interactive: false

Fields

Field Default Description
environment development Environment type
log_level normal Logging verbosity
output_format text CLI output format
no_color false Disable colored output
non_interactive false Disable interactive prompts

Environment Types

Environment Description
development Local development
test Test suites
staging Pre-production
production Production deployment

Log Levels

Level Shows Use Case
quiet Errors only Test suites
normal Info and above Production
verbose Debug and above Development
debug Everything Troubleshooting

Output Formats

Format Use Case
text Human interaction
json Log aggregation, machine parsing
yaml Config inspection

Environment-Specific Examples

Development

runtime:
  environment: development
  log_level: verbose
  output_format: text

Production

runtime:
  environment: production
  log_level: normal
  output_format: json
  no_color: true
  non_interactive: true

CI/CD

runtime:
  environment: staging
  log_level: normal
  output_format: json
  no_color: true
  non_interactive: true

Environment Variables

Variable Effect
NO_COLOR Disables colored output
CI Enables non-interactive mode

See the Runtime Configuration Playbook for detailed technical information.
